flawed_nl_solution:
Her children ate 25% of the 16 brownies so they ate 0.25*16 = <<25*0.01*16=4>>4 slices
There were 16 brownies and the children ate 4 slices, leaving 16-4 = <<16-4=14>>14 brownies
The family ate 50% of the remaining 14 brownies so they ate 0.5*14 = <<50*0.01*14=7>>7 brownies
There were 14 brownies and they ate 7 which leaves 14-7 = <<14-7=7>>7 brownies
Lorraine had 1 more of the 7 remaining brownies which leaves 7-1 = <<7-1=6>>6 brownies
#### 6

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 14. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
